title: fennic
author: fennic
content: Do you think it is good to teach kids in school about crypto and blockchain?Or should we see education about crypto and blockchain in higher education?+I think it would bring great change in next generations, as maybe people of today are not yet mature enough to accept idea of decentralization.I think it would be so cool to learn about Blockchain in our universities. So that it will give us mass adoption of Cryptocurrency in near future.

comments.author: Frankolala
comments.body: Crypto(bitcoin) should be taught to everybody of age 15yrs and above, and it can be taught anywhere not especially in schools. School is the best place to educate the students about bitcoin since they are the leaders of tomorrow,I mean from Senior secondary school and above are the students that should have this knowledge. The reason why I said it should not be taught in school alone is because bitcoin awareness is still spreading, some persons have  the awareness and some don't have, and some person have the awareness but they don't understand or like the concept because it hasn't be adopted in their country especially the old ones. So my point is this those people that are not privilege to attend higher institution, will you say they don't need bitcoin awareness or education, no it is a digital currency ,that the purpose for its creation is for financial freedom . Bitcoin should be taught every place that brings people together,for example schools,place of work,market place,neighborhood, meetings and if possible also in church. Teaching it in all these mentioned places will help the spread and education faster, whatever you know its good and benefitable like bitcoin knowledge to you is also good for everyone,if you are benefiting from bitcoin directly or indirectly then you need to give the awareness to other people around you not just for only a specific persons.Thanks

comments.body: Quote from: fennic on October 06, 2022, 07:37:01 AMDo you think it is good to teach kids in school about crypto and blockchain?Why note, it's something worth doing but you must be careful to limit the knowledge to their respective age and ensure you only start a the preliminary levelQuote from: fennic on October 06, 2022, 07:37:01 AMOr should we see education about crypto and blockchain in higher education?It can also be taught in higher academic level and this time in the advance level, but it just has to go along with courses related to finances and including cryoto and blockchain technology as a topic or subject is a very good idea since that's the level the world economy and financial system newly operates in.

comments.author: SquirrelJulietGarden
comments.body: Courses about Bitcoin, cryptocurrency, blockchain are more popular in recent years.[LIST] Institutions offering blockchain courses and programs in the world.Your question, can or can not teach about it in your class, I don't know. It depends on policies of government and of that university or college. If government does not prohibit it, you can propose it to that university or college. You must get approval before you can start teaching about that officially.

comments.author: Die_empty
comments.body: Quote from: fennic on October 06, 2022, 07:37:01 AMDo you think it is good to teach kids in school about crypto and blockchain?I don't think it would be ideal to introduce children between the age of 1-10 to the crypto space except if they have an uncommon interest or knowledge. Children at this stage should focus on some foundational learning that would improve both their emotional and educational well-being. The syllabus of both the nursery and primary school has enough financial and educational topics that would serve as a springboard for the introduction of crypto and blockchain in the nearest future. Children should be allowed to enjoy their childhood stage and not be bombarded with strange terms or concepts. QuoteOr should we see education about crypto and blockchain in higher education?+Senior secondary school and the higher education level is the ideal time to introduce students to the crypto space. At this stage, they can be able to comprehend and understand the workings or the operation of the crypto industry. There are many universities that offer courses on blockchain and other related areas. Some schools in El Salvador are offering diploma and other certificate courses on Bitcoin technology.   QuoteI think it would bring great change in next generations, as maybe people of today are not yet mature enough to accept idea of decentralization.I think it would be so cool to learn about Blockchain in our universities. So that it will give us mass adoption of Cryptocurrency in near future. Bitcoin education is the bedrock for the mass adoption of the currency. People need to learn about Bitcoin and understand some uncommon opportunities it offers. Although we need some scholarly work on Bitcoin from universities, one doesn't need to enroll in any of these universities to learn about Bitcoin. The internet is filled with enough information that can give even a dummy comprehensive knowledge about the Bitcoin space.

comments.author: kryptqnick
comments.body: I believe that the basics about cryptos, blockchain and Bitcoin should be taught at school and at universities. It's not an 'either-or' situation. At school, the most obvious integration is into Economics and into IT classes. At universities, it can depend on a degree a person is getting and the courses students choose based on their interests. This way, some will be left with the basics they learned at school, while others will be able to dive into more detail if they want to do that.Also, the op is talking about schools and unis as a hypothetical, but in fact, it's already the case at some places. I remember that cryptos were included into school curriculum in France nationwide, for instance. There are also individual schools and cases in other countries, to the very least. As for universities, it seems more widespread and some crypto-related courses are offered in many countries, while some, I believe, even offer blockchain-related degrees or specializations.

comments.author: Beefcake
comments.body: I think it doesn't matter that much. Most people will end up using some form of crypto eventually, just like most of us use some form of motorized transportation. But, how many people who ride in a car or bus or whatever understands what the 4 stroke cycle is, or the difference between a 4 stroke and 2 stroke motor, or what the distributor cap does, etc. It is useful, so they use it. As things progress, solutions continue to evolve that require less technical expertise, and people get used to using it. Some day, it will be common just like credit cards, and most people will just use it. Those who want to dig further will do so, but I think most people aren't interested in how it works. All that said, I don't think it's a bad idea to offer classes. Probably see 4 year crypto bachelor's degrees sooner or later.
